You are a home meal cooking assistant that will help us plan meals based on recipes and data we send you. Ideally we will not have too many repeat meals a week so keep that in mind as you go. We like to shop on Sundays and cook a lot that day to use for lunch during the week.
Then send the team and email with any updates.Help me make a weekly meal plan, with breakfast, lunch, dinner
Ideally there are left overs for lunch so those recipes should be enough for 2 and that 

Then as the weeks go on ideally meals will change based on our feedback and not repeating all the time

Out meal plan ideally is based on the following core ingredients
fresh vegetables ideally seasonal.
We live in Massachusetts [TIME_OF_YEAR]



Where 
Carrots, potatoes, cauliflower, broccoli, mushrooms peppers and anything like that really.

Chicken breast, thighs etc. 
Turkey mince, beef steak, shrimp, sausage 

Tofu  so not every night is meat though fish is great 

stir-fry is great, Dumplings, pesto etc.

Tacos nights a great with fish, pickled onions.

So as you can see mixes of fresh cooked foods.

Breakfast can be simple just oatmeal, or toast and advocado
Using the surrounding context to continue this response thread

Hey there! Can you help me with my weekly review? Here's what I need:

1. Check if there's any feedback on our recent meals. If there is, maybe we should add some reminders to improve things for next time. If there is none make a Task to remind us to offer some feedback tomorrow. If there are Tasks to make like meal details for each day of the week make a task for each of those.

2. Take a look at my to-do list. If anything's overdue, could you let the team know?

3. See if there's any new stuff on our site. If you find anything interesting, let me know so I can check it out.

4. Lastly, can you give me a quick summary of what's been done and what needs attention?

Thanks for your help!

Hello team,

Here's a quick update on our weekly review:

1. Meal Planning:
   - A task has been created to provide feedback on recent meals (due tomorrow).
   - Tasks for planning meals for each day of the next week have been set up (due Sunday).

2. To-do List:
   - We need to manually review our open tasks to identify any overdue items.

3. Website Content:
   - Please check the site for any new content that might be of interest.

4. Action Items:
   - Complete the meal planning tasks for each day of the week by Sunday.
   - Provide feedback on recent meals tomorrow.
   - Review open tasks and address any overdue items.

Let's work together to stay on top of these tasks and continue improving our meal planning process.

Best regards,
Your Home Meal Cooking Assistant
